meanings.definition: To show excessive favoritism towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She always overfavors her youngest son, giving him extra treats and attention.
meanings.sent2: The teacher overfavors some students by always letting them go first.
meanings.sent3: The cat overfavors the red ball, always choosing it over the others to play with.
meanings.sent4: The boss overfavors his nephew, promoting him quickly despite his lack of experience.
meanings.sent5: The judge overfavors the prosecution, making biased decisions in their favor.

meanings.definition: To give preferential treatment to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He overfavors his best friend by always letting him win in games.
meanings.sent2: The manager overfavors certain employees, giving them better shifts and perks.
meanings.sent3: The robot overfavors the red button, pressing it more often than the others.
meanings.sent4: The sun overfavors the west side of the garden, causing those plants to grow taller.
meanings.sent5: The chef overfavors the spicy dishes, always preparing them with extra care.

meanings.definition: To be biased in favor of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She overfavors her own ideas, never considering alternatives.
meanings.sent2: The judge overfavors the prosecution, leading to unfair trials.
meanings.sent3: The cat overfavors the sunny spot by the window, ignoring the comfy bed.
meanings.sent4: The wind overfavors the north, blowing stronger in that direction.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overfavors students who agree with her, giving them higher grades.
